intro: Ossaea zvetankae, commonly known as the Bulgarian starwort, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Bulgaria. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Its flowers are small and white, with a distinctive star-like appearance, contributing to its common name. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ossaea zvetankae is considered a vulnerable species.
